AFFILIATED WITH THE AMERICAN FEDERATION OF LABOR
15 WEST 44th STREET • NEW YORK 18, N. Y.
TELEPHONE VANDERBILT 6-1810
March 29, 1951
A. Frank Reel
National
Executive Secretary
Mr. Richard L. Rider
Rational Association of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Ur bans. * Illinois
Dear Mr. Rider:
In reply to your letter of March 20th, this will constitute
permission for all of the stations which you have listed in
your letter with the exception of 7JRYG, to receive off-the-
line recordings of'the* atomic energy Series done by WIS in
Chicago for one broadcast of each program.
This does not permit the second list of stations keeping copies
for additional use. If you can work out some arrangement with
those stations whereby the copies vri.ll be returned to you after
they have had their in-school use, we will grant such permission,
but we do not wish to allow' these copies to be kept by the sta¬
tions or schools.
The reason for our making an exception of INTO is because altho*
we realize this is a non-commercial station, it is a station with
which we h$ve had considerable difficulty. This station employs
staff announcers who are members of AFRA. It pays them miserably
low wages. Because they are municipal employees, our ordinary
economic weapon is not available to us. Consequently, we have
been forced to take the position that we can in no way aid this
station to obtain programming of any sort unless and until it
takes steps to alleviate the deplorable conditions that exist with
respect to the announcing staff*
Sincerely,
AMERICAN FEDERATION OF RADIO ARTISTS
A. FRANK REEL
NATIONAL EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
